usefulItems: baking tray (30 cm x 40 cm), baking paper, rolling pin, serving bowl, cling film, heat-resistant bowl, oven, refrigerator
title: Chia and quinoa tortillas with a trio of dips

ingredients.content: 50 g chia seeds, white or black
Sun-dried tomato, chilli and cashew dip
30 g Parmesan cheese, cut into cubes (3 cm)
1 red pepper, deseeded and cut into quarters
500 g pumpkin, flesh only, cut into pieces (4 cm)
1 tsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
extra virgin olive oil, for greasing
60 g Parmesan cheese, cut into cubes (3 cm)

preparations.content: Preparation
Chia and quinoa tortilla chips
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place quinoa and chia into mixing bowl and mill <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cornmeal, sesame seeds, salt, lime juice and water and mix <b>6 sec/speed 6<b>, or until a dough forms.

Divide the dough into 4 pieces. Place 1 piece of the dough between 2 pieces of baking paper and roll out into a rectangle (1-2 mm thick). Using a sharp, wet knife, cut rectangle of dough into triangles, then place triangles onto prepared baking tray. Repeat with remaining 3 portions of dough.
Bake for 8-10 minutes (200°C), or until just golden. Set aside and allow tortilla chips to cool before removing from baking tray.
Sun-dried tomato, chilli and cashew dip
Place chilli, garlic and Parmesan into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 10<b>.

Add coriander, cashew nuts, red pepper, lemon juice, sun-dried tomatoes and olive oil and chop <b>Turbo/0.5 sec/2-3 times<b>. Transfer into a serving bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Pumpkin dip
Preheat oven to 250°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper, then place pumpkin onto it and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 10 minutes (250°C), then reduce oven temperature to 180°C and bake for a further 10-15 minutes (180°C). Set pumpkin aside to cool.
Place pine nuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add goat's cheese, basil, cumin, salt, pepper and cooled pumpkin and blend <b>6 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer into a serving bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Artichoke dip
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a heat-resistant bowl (approx. 450 ml) and set aside.
Place half of the Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add remaining Parmesan and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add artichoke and chop <b>Turbo/0.5 sec/1-3 times<b>.
Add mayonnaise and reserved Parmesan and mix <b>3 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into prepared bowl and bake for 20 minutes (180°C). Serve hot.
